creator: bjoern@syltonline.de
text:
The ocumentation sais that the newer jks recognize changes in the config-files 
and reload theyr configuration automatically. On our jk1.2.21, this works fine 
for uriworkermap.properties, but not for workers.properties.
In the jk-manager, there is also no option to reload them manually as it was 
in JK2.
This was our only way to drain a aqpplication worker from all webserver-farms.

Could you please point out the exact documentation page and text you refer to,
so we can clarify?

Correct would be: it does automatically detect changes to the uriworker map, but
it does not detect changes to workers.properties.

You can change many config items dynamically in the status worker, but you
cannot persist the changes without editing the config files in parallel.
creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de

text:
I read it in the Changelogs. But you are right, only uriworkermap.properties 
is mentioned. In JK2, they were in the same file as the workers.properties, so 
we assumed both file-autoreloads had been ported from JK2 to 1. I think it was 
mentioned that all major funktions of JK2 would be backported.

There is no way to change settings like disableing a worker in the jk-manager 
for big IIS farms. We got 30 Webs on a 3 node cluster, and 3 likewise 
clusters. All run in different application pools, so no shared mem there to 
transport changes. That would mean, we would have to configure nearly 300 jk-
manager - just to drain one node. And not even that is possible because the jk-
manager shouldn't be enabled on unsecured webs with IIS (Anonymous, non-https).

A global deployment of workers.properties on the other hand is verry simple.

But I understand now that this is no bug but a feature request, right?
creator: bjoern@syltonline.de

text:
Yes, not a bug, and I'm pretty sure this will not come in 1.2.x.

I changed to "Later", so we might consider at least partial solutions for JK3,
which is the project name for the next development branch, which is in a *very*
early stage.
